General interval comment: 5x3 cm large clast of (fully?) serpentinized ultramafic rock with no visible crystals. It features sub-mm white serpentine veins.
4x4 cm large clast of (fully?) serpentinized ultramafic rock with no visible crystals. It features sub-mm white serpentine veins.
2x1.5 cm large clast of serpentinized harzburgite with 20% Opx or bastite. It features sub-mm white and green serpentine veins and vein planes towards the sides.
6x3 cm large clast of (fully?) serpentinized ultramafic rock with no visible crystals. It features sub-mm white serpentine veins.
Five pebble-sized (3-5 cm) and several sub-cm clasts of (fully?) serpentinized ultramafic rock with no visible crystals. They feature sub-mm white serpentine veins.

Matrix comments: Mud has some lighter bluish and white lamaellae and may resemble a former ultramafic rock clast.

General interval comment: 3x3 cm large clast of (fully?) serpentinized ultramafic rock with no visible crystals. It features multiple veins with gray halos which are crosscut by later mm to sub-mm white serpentine veins.
10x5 cm large clast of (fully?) serpentinized ultramafic rock with no visible crystals. It features multiple veins with gray halos which are crosscut by later mm to sub-mm white serpentine veins.
5x2 cm large clast of (fully?) serpentinized ultramafic rock with no visible crystals. It features multiple veins with gray halos which are crosscut by later mm to sub-mm white serpentine veins.
4x1.5 cm large clast of (fully?) serpentinized ultramafic rock with no visible crystals. It features multiple veins with gray halos which are crosscut by later mm to sub-mm white serpentine veins.

11x5 cm large clast of serpentinized harzburgite with 10% Opx, most of which is altered to bastite. It features multiple veins with gray halos which are crosscut by later mm to sub-mm white-green serpentine veins.

11x5 cm large clast of serpentinized harzburgite with 10% Opx, most of which is altered to bastite, and some spinel. It features multiple veins with gray halos which are crosscut by two later mm to sub-mm white-green serpentine veins.

4x3 cm large clast of serpentinized harzburgite with 20% Opx, most of which is altered to bastite, and some spinel. It features multiple veins with gray halos which are crosscut by one later mm to sub-mm white-green serpentine veins.
5x4 cm large clast of (fully?) serpentinized ultramafic rock with no visible crystals. It features sub-mm white serpentine veins.

Clast comments: Clasts of ultramafic rock as described for Core U1498B-3R. Some of the clasts seem to fall apart towards their sides, becoming part of the matrix.
Matrix comments: Mud has some lighter bluish and white lamaellae.

Clast comments: Clasts are severely serpentinized and mechanically weak. Some grade into the surrounding matrix. Drilling may have deformed some of the clasts.

General interval comment: 26x6 cm clast of variably serpentinzed haryburgite with 10% Opx, most of it is altered to bastite. Some bastite may have turned into clay, especially towards the top the clast, where it shows abundant white and green (chrysotile?) veins. The abundance of veins is diminishing towards the bottom. The clast is broken into three pieces.

3x2 cm large clast of serpentinized ultramafic rock with minor Opx content, most of which is altered to bastite. It features multiple veins with gray halos which are crosscut by later mm to sub-mm white-green serpentine veins.
Five pieces of 1-2 cm and several smaller pieces of serpentinized ultramafic rock, some of which is harzburgite with altered Opx (now clay?).

39x6 cm large clast of harzburgite with 15% Opx, some of which is altered to bastite, and some spinel. Rare veins of green serpentine with Frankenstein-like features cross the clast. The clast is broken into two pieces.

6x3 cm large clast of serpentinized harzburgite with 10% Opx content, most of which is altered to bastite. It features few veins with gray halos which are crosscut by later mm to sub-mm white-green serpentine veins.

17x6 cm large clast of serpentinized harzburgite with <10% Opx, most of which is altered to bastite. It features multiple vein generations, the most prominent are up to 3 mm wide white-green serpentine veins (presumably chrysotile).
MENA, MBIO, IW
Several pieces of same metavolcanic clast, pale gray green to gray, cut by abundant veins of white mineral, plus calcite veins. Veins 1-2 mm thick, some composite veins up to 6 mm thick
Lump of green clay
Small 2 cm clast of greenish white microcrystalline rock with shear bands.
Small 4 cm clast of gray-green metavolcanic rock, no veins.
Blue serpentine mud swirled with green and blue-green mud. Black UM clasts typically plastically deformed, but one clast is rigid.
Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now "clay". About 60% "clasts" as defined above.
Clast comments: Plastically deformed with the matrix.

General interval comment: Pale green with darker green, Darker green parts may be vein fragments. No black UM clasts this interval.

"Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now ""clay"". About 60% ""clasts"" as defined above. One rigid clast of "rock" at bottom of section.

"Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now "clay". About 50% "clasts" as defined above. Two large intact UM clasts of rock: one at 0-9 cm and one at 59-66 cm.
Clast comments: Rigid clasts are black harzburgites with abundant Opx / bastite in cores, aphanitic black rims in mud.

General interval comment: IW MBIO
Blue serpentine mud, with green swirls, containing small black UM clasts. Most of the small UM clasts are deformed plastically. One small one piece 1 cm - pale serpentine.
"Blue and green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now ""clay"". About 25% ""clasts"" as defined above. "

"Blue and green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now ""clay"". About 20% ""clasts"" as defined above. Two rigid clasts at 41-44 cm of serpentinized harzburgite.

General interval comment: Blue and green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now clay. About 20% clasts as defined above.
Blue and green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now clay. About 20% clasts as defined above.
Continuous interval of harzburgite broken into 4 pieces, with some serpentine mud packed around them. Cut by thin serpentine veins.

Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now clay. About 45% clasts as defined above. No rigid clasts in this interval.

General interval comment: Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now clay. Two large and one small rigid clasts of serpentinized UM rock. Biggest is 8 x 6 cm, the next 4 x 5, the smallest is 2 x 2.

Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now clay. One large and rigid clasts of serpentinized UM rock with size of 5 x 3 is brecciated due to drilling disturbance.
Clast comments: A Rigid clast is broken due to drilling.

General interval comment: Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now clay. Two rigid clasts occur at the bottom. The sizes are 6.5 x 5 cm and 3 x 3 cm.
Clast comments: Two rigid clast at the bottom are serpentinized harzburgite (90 % alteration). Bastite 12% with maximum size 3 mm.

Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now clay. Four rigid serpentinized harzburgites.
Clast comments: Clasts are harzburgite with 15-20 % opx (80-90 alteration).

General interval comment: Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and shattered clasts of UM rock that are now clay. Rigid clasts at 69-83 cm, 119-130 cm, 133-137 cm.
Clast comments: Harzburgites with pebble size are >90% serpentinized. The cobble-sized harzburgite are moderately serpentinized (60%; primary mantle minerals present).

Lithology prefix+name+suffix [read only]: serpentinite pebbly mud with lithic clasts
General interval comment: Green and black serpentinite mud, swirled together. The black parts a highly deformed and elongate clasts of UM rock that are now clay. Rigid clasts are harzburgite (4-11 cm) and dunite (17-27 cm). The harzburgite show sharp serpentinization boundary.
Clast comments: The harzburgite clast contains 20 % opx and 80 % Ol. Degree of serpentinization is 80 %. White and green veins. The dunite clast is almost serpentinized (98%), crosscut by pale green veins.
